conclusion: To determine when the particle is farthest from the starting point, we need to analyze the given acceleration-time graph.

The acceleration a starts at 0, increases linearly to a0 at time t0/2, decreases linearly back to 0 at time t0, becomes negative and decreases further to -a0 at time 3t0/2, and finally returns to 0 at time 2t0.

premise: The acceleration-time graph describes the acceleration a of the particle as a function of time t.
conclusion: The velocity v(t) is the integral of the acceleration a(t).

conclusion: The area under the acceleration-time graph gives the change in velocity.
